message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The colleague is likely experiencing grief and may be struggling with alcohol use as a coping mechanism. Confronting the colleague in private may not be effective as he may be in denial or defensive. Informing the Physician Health Program is the most appropriate action as they can provide confidential support and resources for the colleague. Informing patients or alerting the Licensing Board may not be necessary at this time and may cause unnecessary harm to the colleague's reputation and career.

Alerting the State Licensing Board should only be done if there is evidence of a severe breach in ethics or safety concerns that cannot be addressed through other means.
